articles.description: Coming to you live from the streets of Tbilisi, Georgia, I break down my predictions for who will be UFC champion in every weight class by the end of 2026. With the sport coming off a brief lull and huge storylines brewing around interim titles, injuries, potential super fights, and the new Paramount deal, I go division by division discussing fighters like Merab Dvalishvili, Paddy Pimblett, Islam Makhachev, Khamzat Chimaev, Alex Pereira, and the heavyweight chaos surrounding Tom Aspinall. articles.title: The White House UFC Rumors Don‚Äôt Add Up
articles.description: There‚Äôs a lot being said about the rumored White House fight card‚Äîand most of it doesn‚Äôt survive even a basic reality check. In this piece, I revisit the claims going around about a massive White House UFC-style event, including rumors of seven world title fights, fighters being held back from other cards, and the idea that pay-per-view is suddenly dead. These stories gained traction fast‚Äîbut traction doesn‚Äôt mean truth. Let‚Äôs start with the contradictions. The same rumors pushing seven title fights are also telling you that Conor McGregor is headlining‚Ä¶ and that a potential **Jon Jones vs Alex Pereira fight is the main attraction. None of those fights involve a belt. All of these things cannot be true at the same time. History matters here. Promoters don‚Äôt stack cards with endless title fights because it kills pacing, time, and broadcast structure. The biggest fights we‚Äôve seen recently‚Äî**Mike Tyson vs Jake Paul, or the return of Conor‚Äîworked because there was no belt attached. If this were real breaking news, you wouldn‚Äôt hear it from anonymous sources. You‚Äôd hear it from Dana White. And you didn‚Äôt. The fight business runs on numbers, not fantasies. Very few people ever had to make those numbers work. Watch more unfiltered fight business breakdowns right here. #UFC #WhiteHouseEvent #DanaWhite #ConorMcGregor #JonJones #MMA #FightBusiness #ChaelSonnenBad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Is Ilia Topuria REALLY the Scariest Man in the UFC? #ufc
articles.description: Justin Gaethje says the idea of drawing Ilia Topuria scares him ‚Äî but Chael Sonnen isn‚Äôt convinced yet. In this clip, Chael breaks down what actually makes a fighter terrifying at the elite level. Is Ilia the best boxer in the UFC? Have we seen dominant wrestling? Submission threats that force opponents to panic? Chael says he hasn‚Äôt seen enough to call Ilia the boogeyman of the sport. He compares the reaction to Ilia with how Gaethje spoke about Islam Makhachev and Khabib Nurmagomedov ‚Äî and points out the difference between hype and proven fear. Now Chael turns it back on the fans: Is Ilia Topuria truly one of the scariest fighters in MMA, or is that reputation ahead of the evidence?

articles.title: Where Does Tom Aspinall Rank All-Time Right Now?
articles.description: A tough question has emerged around Tom Aspinall‚Äîand it isn‚Äôt as straightforward as it sounds. If Aspinall were forced to retire today due to injury, where would he rank in the history of the UFC heavyweight division? Not long ago, Aspinall was widely viewed as the first legitimate favorite to defeat Jon Jones. Sportsbooks reflected that belief, something no previous opponent had ever achieved. From a potential standpoint, that alone places Aspinall in rare company. But greatness debates rarely stay focused on potential. They almost always drift toward resumes. Title wins. Defenses. Longevity. And that‚Äôs where the conversation becomes complicated. Heavyweight history is uniquely difficult to compare across eras. Earlier champions often competed at heavyweight due to limited divisions, not size or athletic ceiling. Modern heavyweights like Aspinall represent a different physical standard altogether‚Äîbut resumes still matter. This breakdown explores the tension between peak ability and documented accomplishment, using past champions as context while examining why Aspinall‚Äôs case doesn‚Äôt fit neatly into traditional rankings. He may possess the highest upside the division has ever seen, yet still fall outside many all-time lists if careers are measured strictly by achievements. The question isn‚Äôt meant as criticism. It‚Äôs an honest look at how greatness is judged‚Äîand why Tom Aspinall‚Äôs story isn‚Äôt finished yet. #TomAspinall #UFC #Heavyweight #MMA #JonJones #GOATDebate #FightAnalysis #ChaelSonnen Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Could Ciryl Gane Have Finished Tom Aspinall?
articles.description: A controversial question is back on the table: could Ciryl Gane have beaten‚Äîand even finished‚ÄîTom Aspinall if their fight continued? One of Gane‚Äôs training partners believes the momentum was swinging so hard that Gane wasn‚Äôt just going to win‚Ä¶ he was going to stop him. This breakdown revisits what actually happened in the short window the fans got to see. The matchup quickly turned into a kickboxing fight‚ÄîGane is a professional kickboxer, while Aspinall‚Äôs striking pedigree has been built primarily in the gym and in MMA rounds. On paper, that dynamic favors Gane the longer the fight goes, while Aspinall‚Äôs best chance typically comes early as the heavier power puncher. But there‚Äôs one moment that gets overlooked: Aspinall‚Äôs takedown attempt that ‚Äúmissed by a mile.‚Äù Many used that as proof the fight would always stay on the feet. The argument here is different‚Äîrewatching suggests the entry wasn‚Äôt simply poor timing or distance. The claim is that an earlier eye poke helped steer Aspinall off the shot before the fight-ending sequence ever happened. If that‚Äôs true, it changes the conversation. Not because it declares a winner, but because it reframes the wrestling question and what each man can adjust in a rematch. Can Aspinall actually get to the hips if the setup is clean? Can Gane consistently manage the entries without fouls while using footwork to extend the fight? Three minutes is not enough to ‚Äúsolve‚Äù this matchup‚Äîbut it‚Äôs enough to make the rematch even more compelling. #UFC #TomAspinall #CirylGane #MMA #Heavyweight #FightAnalysis #Rematch #ChaelSonnen Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Jake Paul vs Francis Ngannou Is the Fight
articles.description: Chael Sonnen asks the real question after the Anthony Joshua fight: What should Jake Paul do next? Sitting at home with a broken jaw, Jake Paul calls out Francis Ngannou ‚Äî and suddenly, the conversation gets very serious. Francis is massive. Francis is a world champion. And based on what we just saw, this fight is incredibly intriguing, even if it‚Äôs unlikely to go Jake‚Äôs way. Chael breaks down why Jake Paul vs Francis Ngannou makes sense, what a win would actually mean, and whether this is the kind of fight you take to go out on top ‚Äî or if Jake is the kind of competitor who can never stop chasing ‚Äúone more.‚Äù This isn‚Äôt about hype anymore. This is about legacy.

articles.title: Red Panty Night Is Still Real
articles.description: Another Conor McGregor tweet made headlines‚Äîand that‚Äôs exactly why it matters. When Conor McGregor jokingly challenged Floyd Mayweather to an MMA fight at the White House, it was absurd by design. No other fighter‚Äîregardless of star power‚Äîcould post something that ridiculous and still dominate the news cycle. That ability is the compliment. The tweet also included a familiar name: Michael Chandler. McGregor ended the joke by reaffirming what has remained consistent whenever reality replaces theatrics‚Äîif McGregor fights, it will be Chandler. That consistency matters, especially in an industry that is rapidly shifting toward spectacle-driven matchmaking. The breakdown also explores why the Chandler matchup has become strangely complicated. Influential voices like Jon Anik have publicly questioned its appeal, while weight class confusion and main event expectations continue to cloud the conversation. What remains clear is that McGregor does not fight at 155 pounds anymore, and any return will likely involve unconventional terms. The most revealing moment revisited is McGregor‚Äôs blunt exchange with Chandler‚Äîending with the now-infamous line: ‚ÄúYou will do what you‚Äôre told.‚Äù Chandler had no rebuttal then, and three years later, none exists. McGregor‚Äôs power isn‚Äôt just drawing attention‚Äîit‚Äôs controlling direction. And whether the headlines are serious or silly, red panty night is still very real. #ConorMcGregor #MichaelChandler #FloydMayweather #UFC #MMA #FightBusiness #RedPantyNight #ChaelSonnen Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Did Gable Steveson Pick the Wrong Mentor?
articles.description: Did Gable Steveson choose the right mentor‚Äîor the most dangerous one to imitate? In this clip, Chael breaks down a thoughtful warning made by Brendan Schaub after Gable publicly referred to Jon Jones as a mentor. That single word carries weight. A mentor isn‚Äôt just someone you admire for what they do in competition‚Äîit‚Äôs someone whose life, habits, and decisions you may try to replicate. Jon Jones is one of the greatest fighters who has ever lived. There‚Äôs no debate there. But his path is unique, chaotic, and non-transferable. Brendan‚Äôs point wasn‚Äôt disrespect‚Äîit was responsibility. Young athletes don‚Äôt just copy success inside the cage; they often copy what happens outside of it too. I explain why Jon Jones‚Äô career worked for Jon Jones‚Äîand why trying to follow that same blueprint is risky for anyone else. We also talk about mentorship, post-career purpose, and why greatness doesn‚Äôt automatically translate into guidance. There is only one Jon Jones. Admire him‚Äîbut don‚Äôt try to become him. Watch more fight analysis, fighter psychology, and unfiltered MMA truth right here. #GableSteveson #JonJones #BrendanSchaub #UFC #MMA #Wrestling #FightAnalysis #chaelsonnen Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Is Suga Sean Done with a Loss to Song Yadong?
articles.description: When a fighter says, ‚ÄúIf I lose, I‚Äôm out,‚Äù you usually ignore it. But when Sean O‚ÄôMalley says it, you have to stop and listen. In this clip, Chael Sonnen reacts to recent comments from O‚ÄôMalley about his future following a loss to Merab Dvalishvili and ahead of a dangerous matchup with Song Yadong. O‚ÄôMalley outlined a bold plan‚Äîbeat Song, beat Petr Yan, reclaim gold, and make 2026 ‚Äúthe year of Suga.‚Äù But then came the line that changed the conversation: ‚ÄúIf I lose-lose, I‚Äôm out.‚Äù Chael breaks down why this statement is different from the usual fighter talk. Most athletes can‚Äôt walk away‚Äîeven if they want to. O‚ÄôMalley is one of the rare exceptions. He‚Äôs made real money, avoided the financial traps that keep fighters stuck, and built a brand that survives outside the cage. That gives his words real weight. Chael also questions the logic behind the Song Yadong matchup, how the UFC matchmaking philosophy under Dana White works, and why every fight needs a clear ‚Äúwhy‚Äù‚Äîbecause punches and kicks alone haven‚Äôt been enough for years. So if Sean O‚ÄôMalley loses‚Ä¶ is he actually done? That‚Äôs the question‚Äîand the answer isn‚Äôt as obvious as you think. üëâ Watch more fight analysis and behind-the-scenes breakdowns right here. #SeanOMalley #SugaSean #UFC #MMA #SongYadong #PetrYan #ChaelSonnen #FightAnalysis #CombatSports Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: The Path for Alex Pereira to Become UFC Heavyweight Champion #ufc
articles.description: Chael Sonnen breaks down why Alex Pereira may be just one win away from ending the GOAT discussion entirely. To become UFC heavyweight champion, Pereira‚Äôs path is clear ‚Äî but brutal. It likely runs through Tom Aspinall, Jon Jones, or Ciryl Gane. Whether it‚Äôs waiting for Aspinall, fighting for an interim title, or taking on Jon Jones directly, none of these options are easy ‚Äî but all of them are possible. Chael explains how Pereira‚Äôs resume, combined with one more championship win at heavyweight, could put him in a category few fighters have ever reached. This isn‚Äôt hype. This is the math behind greatness.

articles.title: Justin Gaethje‚Äôs ‚ÄòStaph Infection‚Äô...
articles.description: Rumors popped up that Justin Gaethje was dealing with a staph infection‚Äîand almost immediately, Gaethje denied it. So what‚Äôs real, what‚Äôs noise, and what actually matters? In this clip, Chael Sonnen explains why skin infections like staph and ringworm have always been part of combat sports culture‚Äîand why the sudden panic around them is largely misplaced. From mandatory skin checks to disclosure rules with athletic commissions, Chael walks through how this process actually works behind the scenes. Most importantly, Chael addresses the only two questions that really count: Will the fight be canceled? And would something like this affect the odds? The short answer: no. According to publicly available betting data from DraftKings, the line hasn‚Äôt moved at all. That tells you everything you need to know about how seriously this is being taken by people who put money behind their opinions. Chael also explains why fighters sometimes downplay medical details, why antibiotics are routine and manageable, and why visible skin issues look far more dramatic to fans than they are in reality. This isn‚Äôt a scandal. It‚Äôs not new. And it‚Äôs not affecting the fight. üëâ For real fight analysis‚Äînot internet hysteria‚Äîwatch more right here. #JustinGaethje #UFC #MMA #FightNews #ChaelSonnen #CombatSports #UFCRumors #SportsBetting Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: 7 Title Fights at UFC White House is Ridiculous!
articles.description: Everyone has an opinion on fight promotion‚Äîvery few actually understand it. In this clip, Chael Sonnen breaks down why so many public takes on the rumored White House combat sports event are flat-out wrong. Drawing from decades of experience as a competitor, coach, announcer, and one of the longest-licensed promoters in America, Chael explains why stacking ‚Äúsupercards‚Äù with multiple title fights has never worked in entertainment‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs boxing, MMA, movies, or concerts. Chael walks through the real economics of fight promotion: audience caps, fan behavior, live gates, pay-per-view realities, and why the hardcore fanbase represents only a small fraction of total viewers. He also explains why comparing fantasy matchmaking to real-world business decisions ignores history, logic, and financial risk. This isn‚Äôt speculation. This is firsthand knowledge from someone who‚Äôs raised the money, taken the risk, and put on hundreds of events‚Äîoutside the UFC machine. If you‚Äôve heard claims about seven title fights, the biggest stars ever assembled, or ‚Äúguaranteed‚Äù blockbuster formulas, this is the reality check. If you want informed analysis‚Äînot guesswork‚Äîthis is where it starts. üëâ Watch more fight business breakdowns and insider commentary right here. #ChaelSonnen #MMA #UFC #UFCWhiteHouse #CombatSports Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: After Joshua, All Options Are on the Table for Jake Paul #ufc
articles.description: Chael Sonnen explains why the Anthony Joshua fight changed everything for Jake Paul. What started as celebrity boxing turned into something very different the moment Jake Paul chased real competition. Wanting Canelo. Stepping in with Joshua. Taking real damage ‚Äî and earning the respect of people who actually understand fighting. Chael breaks down why fans can no longer dismiss Jake Paul as a gimmick, why his goals were real, and why every option is now on the table ‚Äî boxing, MMA, or even walking away altogether. One fight ended the experiment. What comes next is entirely up to Jake Paul.

articles.title: Bisping‚Äôs Warning to Aspinall Is Chilling...
articles.description: Michael Bisping gave Tom Aspinall advice that hits different‚Äîbecause Bisping isn‚Äôt guessing. He‚Äôs lived it. And when a guy who permanently lost vision tells you ‚Äúdon‚Äôt rush the eye thing,‚Äù you listen. In this breakdown, I‚Äôm talking about Aspinall‚Äôs injury situation after the controversial eye poke that derailed his fight‚Äîand why Bisping‚Äôs warning matters more than any fan opinion. Bisping has publicly detailed how rushing back from eye damage and a detached retina led to irreversible consequences, including fighting while functionally unable to see and having to navigate licensing just to keep competing. And here‚Äôs the other piece: the night it happened, a lot of people claimed Aspinall ‚Äúquit.‚Äù That argument only exists when you don‚Äôt understand what eye trauma looks like in real time‚Äîand why it can absolutely stop a championship fight cold. Talksport Then we get to the bigger issue MMA still refuses to clean up: intentional vs. unintentional fouls. Ariel Helwani made a strong point using another sport as the comparison‚Äîbecause the result of a foul doesn‚Äôt become ‚Äúless real‚Äù just because someone didn‚Äôt mean it. Instagram Watch the full breakdown, and tell me: should MMA treat ‚Äúaccidental‚Äù fouls the same way every time? Subscribe for more straight talk on UFC titles, rules, and matchmaking. #UFC #TomAspinall #MichaelBisping #MMA #UFCNews #EyePoke #ArielHelwani #Heavyweight #CombatSports Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Chael‚Äôs Advice to Jake Paul: Don‚Äôt Fight Ngannou
articles.description: Jake Paul never asked me for advice ‚Äî so I‚Äôm giving it anyway. He goes on Logan Paul‚Äôs IMPAULSIVE podcast with a double broken jaw, still doing interviews, still talking fights, still proving one thing people refuse to admit: the kid is tough. But toughness isn‚Äôt the question. The question is: what is Jake Paul actually chasing? It‚Äôs not money. It‚Äôs not fame. He already had that. From day one, this was about competition ‚Äî and more than anything, it was about respect. And if you don‚Äôt identify the real goal, you can‚Äôt pick the right next opponent. Then Jake does it ‚Äî he calls out Francis Ngannou. As a spectacle, sure, it‚Äôs fascinating. As a business move, it‚Äôs huge. But as a fight? You better be able to answer the only question that matters: why. There‚Äôs a reason John Kavanagh made Conor McGregor explain his ‚Äúwhy‚Äù before letting him fully commit to camp. Because if you can‚Äôt explain it, the audience can‚Äôt enjoy it ‚Äî and you might be risking your future for a moment that doesn‚Äôt even give you what you think it will. Watch the breakdown, and tell me: what should Jake do next ‚Äî and should he stay far away from Ngannou? #JakePaul #FrancisNgannou #Boxing #MMA #Impaulsive #LoganPaul #ConorMcGregor #JohnKavanagh #CombatSports #ChaelSonnen Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Ben Askren & Daniel Cormier on Ben's double lung transplant recovery, DC vs. Jon Jones match, Khabib
articles.description: In a much anticipated episode, Ben Askren IS OFFICIALLY BACK on the Daniel Cormier Show with DC in a brand new edition of Funky & The Champ! Askren talks about his long road to recovery since his double lung transplant. Ben also talks to DC about the days leading up to being in the hospital and what that journey has been like for him as well as his friends and family. After, the guys talk Real American Freestyle (RAF), and Cormier says he'd wrestle Jon Jones and BEAT HIM. Plus, the guys talk about Khabib Nurmagomedov's viral comments about the UFC and promoting superstars, Justin Gaethje "wanting to be scared" to fight Ilia Topuria, and Ben's role with the RAF wrestling competitions! All lines provided by @hardrockbet Follow me on all social media platforms!
